description.narrative:
Assessment and Education Reform Support (AERS) was a component of the Myanmar – UK Partnership for Education (MUPE) programme funded by UK-AID through the Foreign, Commonwealth & Development Office (FCDO).
AERS aimed to contribute to the overall MUPE impact of more relevant learning for all Myanmar’s children, equipping them for life after school. Specifically AERS supported the Ministry of Education (MoE) to design and implement reforms to Myanmar’s assessment system in basic education. With reforms covering all forms of assessment including informal, classroom, school-based, tests and formal examinations, AERS was designed to contribute to development of a high-quality assessment system which supports improved student learning outcomes.
